questions.question: I finished early ………………………. I worked fast.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. We use it to connect two clauses.

questions.question: We were late ……………………….. the storm.
questions.description: Because of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun.

questions.question: ………………………… trying hard, she could not finish the job on time.
questions.description: We use in spite of before an ing form.

questions.question: …………………………….. she tried hard, she could not finish the job on time.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction. We use it to connect two clauses.

questions.question: ………………………. waking up early, I was late for work.
questions.description: Despite and in spite of are interchangeable.

questions.question: ……………………………… the fact that the government refuses to admit it, it has lost the support of the masses.
questions.description: We cannot put a that-clause immediately after in spite of. Hence we introduce it with ‘the fact’.

questions.question: …………………………. the government refuses to admit it, its economic policy has failed time and again.
I always take an umbrella ………………………… it rains.
questions.description: After in case we usually use a present tense to refer to the future.

questions.question: I wrote down his phone number ………………………. I should forget it.
questions.description: Should + infinitive is very common after in case. It adds the meaning ‘by chance’.

questions.question: I wrote down his phone number …………………………. I might forget it.
questions.description: Because I might forget it is similar to in case I should forget it.

questions.question: We will buy a chicken ………………………… we have guests.
If she is late, we will go ………………………. her.
